reasons_to_visit.details: May is when Salzburg's gardens, especially Mirabell Gardens, are in full bloom with vibrant spring flowers, offering picturesque scenery.
The weather in May is generally mild and sunny, perfect for exploring the Old Town, parks, and nearby Alpine areas.
May often marks the beginning of Salzburg's festival season, including events like the Whitsun Festival, showcasing opera and concerts.
Warmer temperatures allow for enjoyable outdoor dining experiences at Salzburg's charming cafes and traditional beer gardens.
The lush green landscapes famous from 'The Sound of Music' are particularly beautiful in May, ideal for tours and exploration.
Access to nearby mountains like Untersberg becomes easier, offering great hiking opportunities with stunning views.
While tourism picks up, May generally has fewer crowds than the peak summer months of July and August.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: Spring weather can be unpredictable, and May can still have rainy days, so packing layers and waterproof gear is wise.
May marks the start of the main tourist season, leading to more crowded attractions and higher demand for accommodation.
Accommodation and flight prices tend to increase in May compared to the shoulder season.
For allergy sufferers, the high pollen count from blooming flowers and trees might be a concern.

weather.precipitation: Occasional spring showers are possible, but sunny days become more frequent.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers, including a light jacket and umbrella. Comfortable shoes are essential for exploring.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate, increasing from April but generally manageable.
tourism_level.pricing: Prices start to rise for accommodation and tours.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Lively and pleasant, with the city fully embracing spring.

events_holidays.name: May Day (Staatsfeiertag)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday in Austria. Some businesses may be closed, but cultural sites are usually open.
events_holidays.notes: Expect some local celebrations or parades.

events_holidays.name: Salzburg Marathon
events_holidays.description: Annual running event through the scenic streets of Salzburg.
events_holidays.notes: Road closures may affect transportation on the day.

unique_experiences.description: Witness the spectacular spring blooms in these famous baroque gardens.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Visit early morning for fewer crowds and better photos.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the fortress with extended daylight hours and pleasant weather.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Consider walking up for exercise or take the funicular.

unique_experiences.description: Wander through the charming streets like Getreidegasse, enjoy cafes, and admire the architecture.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes; explore side streets for hidden gems.

unique_experiences.description: Visit iconic locations from the movie as the landscapes turn green.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book tours in advance; several tour operators available.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy the palace grounds and the fun trick fountains, which typically open for the season in spring.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Be prepared to get slightly wet on the fountain tour!

weather.precipitation: Generally less rain than the first half, with more stable, warmer weather.
weather.general_tips: Light clothing, sunglasses, and sunscreen are recommended. Still have a light jacket for evenings.

tourism_level.crowds: High, especially around Whitsun weekend and towards the end of the month.
tourism_level.pricing: Peak season prices for accommodation and popular attractions.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Vibrant and festive, buzzing with tourists and cultural events.

events_holidays.name: Salzburg Whitsun Festival (Pfingstfestspiele)
events_holidays.description: A prestigious festival focused on Baroque music and opera, often led by renowned artists.
events_holidays.notes: Tickets are highly sought after; book well in advance.

events_holidays.name: Ascension Day (Christi Himmelfahrt)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday. Similar impact as May Day.
events_holidays.notes: Check specific date for the year.

unique_experiences.description: Take the cable car up Untersberg mountain for breathtaking panoramic views of Salzburg and the Alps.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check weather conditions before going; can be cooler at the summit.

unique_experiences.activity: Boat Trip on the Salzach River
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a relaxing boat tour offering unique city views from the river.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Several tour options available, including panorama speedboats.

unique_experiences.description: Experience a traditional Austrian beer garden, enjoying local brews and food.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Augustiner Bräu is a large, traditional monastery brewery.

unique_experiences.activity: Day Trip to the Lake District (Salzkammergut)
unique_experiences.description: Explore the stunning nearby lake region with charming villages and beautiful scenery.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Rent a car or take a bus tour (e.g., Bus 150 to St. Gilgen/Wolfgangsee).

unique_experiences.activity: Attend a Concert at Marble Hall (Mirabell Palace)
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy classical concerts in the opulent setting of the Marble Hall.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book tickets in advance, especially during festival times.
